Description: Backfilling of culverts shall not commence until all the conformance and As Constructed Survey requirements have been met and notice of such works provided to the Administrator.
The design height of fill above culverts shall be as specified in the drawings.

Prior to incorporating any Backfill material into the Works, the Contractor shall submit stockpile or source tests results as specified in Appendix A which demonstrate the source meets the specified material requirements

Material for Backfill shall be as shown on the drawings or as specified elsewhere in the Contract. Where not so shown or specified, material shall be Earth Backfill Material complying with the requirements of Clause 19.2.2
All Backfill materials shall be free of soluble salts, organic matter and other deleterious matter
Backfill material shall not be placed until culverts, structures, pipes, conduits, pits, and so on have been completed and inspected, and any specified curing periods have elapsed.

Backfill Materials
  Earth Backfill Material - MRTS04 Cl 19.2.2
  Select Backfill Material - MRTS04 Cl 19.2.3, Table 19.2.3
  Free Draining Granular Material - MRTS04 Cl 19.2.4, Table 19.2.4
  Sand - MRTS04 Cl 19.2.5, Table 19.2.5
  Coarse sand- MRTS04 Cl 19.2.6, Table 19.2.6
  Bedding Material and drainage aggregate - MRTS Cl 19.2.7, Table 19.2.7
  Filter material - MRTS04 Cl 19.2.8, Table 19.2.8
  Cement Stabilised Unbound Granular Material - MRTS04 Cl 18.2.2, 18.2.5
  Stabilised Sand, Dry Stabilised Sand - MRTS04 Cl 19.2.10, 19.2.11
  Lean Mix Concrete (Min 5 MPa at 28 days) - MRTS04 Cl 19.2.12

Foundation bedding, Haunch, Side and Overlay zones for concrete pipe culverts shall be constructed as shown on Standard Drawing 1359 Culverts – Installation, Bedding and Filling / Backfilling Against / Over Culverts.
Materials for foundation bedding and Haunch Zone shall be Bedding Material complying with the requirements of Clause 19.2.7.
Material for a Side Zone shall be Select Backfill Material complying with the requirements of Clause 19.2.3.

For Overlay Zones, material within 300 mm of the structure, culvert, pipe, and so on shall be Earth Backfill Material complying with the requirements of Clause 19.2.2(Class A1, A2 or Class B except that 100% of the material shall pass 25.0 mm test sieve. Elsewhere, Overlay Zone material may contain Stone sized up to 150 mm maximum dimension.
The construction loads which shall be placed on the culvert shall be as per Clause 12 of MRTS03 Drainage, Retaining Structures and Protective Treatments.

Compaction
Unless specified otherwise in Clause 19.3 or elsewhere in the Contract, Backfill shall be compacted using the compacted layer method of construction in accordance with the requirements of Clause 15, except as may be modified by the requirements of Clause 19.
Backfill which extends into the Subgrade shall conform to the requirements of Clause 18.

Backfill Layer Thickness
Except Sand - >100mm <= 150mm
Sand >100mm <= 300mm

Testing Frequency
As per Appendix A of MRTS04 & Annexure Clause 1 of MRTS03.1
Clause:
MRTS04 Appendix A
MRTS03.1 Annexure Cl 1
